Trends analysis of Indicators is done at Periodic Intervals
No thoroughfare / general traffic in hospital premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that the facility premises are not being used as ‘thoroughfare’ by the general public

checkpoint.name: No water logging in open areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for water accumulation in open areas because of faulty drainage, leakage from the pipes, etc.

checkpoint.name: Open areas are well maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that there is no over grown shrubs, weeds, grass, patholes, bumps etc. in open areas

checkpoint.name: There is no unauthorised occupation within the facility, nor there is encroachment on Hospital land
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for hospital premises and access road have not been encroached by the vendors, unauthorized shops/ occupants, etc.

checkpoint.name: There is no abandoned / dilapidated building within the premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for presence of any ‘abandoned building’ within the facility premises

checkpoint.name: There is a system of periodical inspection for water wastage
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if staff have been assigned duty for periodical inspection of leaking taps, etc.

checkpoint.name: Hospital has a functional rain water harvesting system
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if Hospital Infrastructure and drain system are fitted with rain water harvesting system with sufficient storage capacity

checkpoint.name: Water supply is adequate in Quantity & Quality
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the quantity of water including reservoir and record of its quality

checkpoint.name: Water supply system is maintained in the Hospital
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for leaking taps, pipes, over-flowing tanks and dysfunctional cisterns

checkpoint.name: Hospital promotes water conservation
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if IEC material is displayed for water conservation, and staff & users are made aware of its importance

checkpoint.name: Staff periodically sort useful and unnecessary articles at work station
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask the staff, how frequently they sort and remove unnecessary articles from their work place like Nursing stations, work bench, dispensing counter in Pharmacy, etc. Check for presence of unnecessary articles.

checkpoint.name: The Staff arrange the useful articles, records in systematic manner
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if drugs, instruments, records are not lying in haphazard manner and kept near to point of use in arranged manner. The place has been demarcated for keeping different articles

checkpoint.name: Staff label the articles in identifiable manner
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that drugs, instruments, records, etc. are labelled for facilitating easy identification.

checkpoint.name: Staff has been trained for work place management
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if the facility staff has got any formal/hands on training for managing the workplace (e. g.5’s’)

checkpoint.name: Work stations are clean and free of dirt/dust
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that nursing station, dispensing counter, lab benches, etc. are clean and shining

checkpoint.name: Internal Roads, Pathways, waiting area, etc. are uneven and clean
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that pathways, corridors, courtyards, waiting area, etc. are clean and land landscaped.

checkpoint.name: Green Areas/ Parks/ Open spaces are well maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that wild vegetation does not exist. Shrubs and Trees are well maintained. Over grown branches of plants/ tree have been trimmed regularly. Dry leaves and green waste are removed on daily basis.

checkpoint.name: Facility’s front area is landscaped
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Frontage of the facility has been maintained with grass beds, trees, Garden, etc. and it has an aesthetic appearance

checkpoint.name: Gardens/ green area are secured with fence
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Barricades, fence, wire mesh, Railings, Gates, etc. have been provided for the green area.

checkpoint.name: Provision of Herbal Garden
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if the facility maintains a herbal garden for the medicinal plants

checkpoint.name: Walls are well-plastered and painted
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that wall plaster is not chipped-off and the building is painted/ whitewashed in uniform colour and Paint has not faded away.

checkpoint.name: No unwanted/Outdated posters
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, that facility’s external and internal walls are not studded with irrelevant and out dated posters, slogans, wall writings,graffiti, etc.

checkpoint.name: Interior of patient care areas are plastered & painted
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Interior walls and roof of the outdoor and indoor area are plastered and painted in soothing colour. The Paint has not faded away.

checkpoint.name: Uniform signage system in the Hospital
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: All signages (directional & departmental) are in local language and follow uniform colour scheme.

checkpoint.name: Name of the hospital is prominently displayed at the entrance
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Name of the Hospital is prominently displayed as per state’s policy and convenience of beneficiaries. The name board of the facility is well illuminated in night

checkpoint.name: Measures for Mosquito free environment are in place
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for a. Usage of Mosquito nets by the patients b. Availability of adequate stock of Mosquito nets c. Wire Mesh in windows d. Desert Coolers (if in use) are cleaned regularly/ oil is sprinkled e. No water collection for mosquito breeding within the premises

checkpoint.name: Cattle-trap is installed at the entrance
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check at the entrance of facility that cattle trap has been provided. Also look at the breach, if any, in the boundary wall

checkpoint.name: No stray animals within the facility premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Observe for the presence of stray animals such as dogs, cats, cattle, pigs, etc. within the premises. Also discuss with the facility staff.

checkpoint.name: Pest Control Measures are implemented in the facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask the facility administration about pest control measures to control rodents and insect. Check records of engaging a professional agency for the same

checkpoint.name: Anti-termite Treatment of the wooden furniture and fixtures is undertaken periodically
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if the facility has a scheduled programme for anti-termite treatment at least once in a year

checkpoint.name: Hospital has adequate facility for parking of vehicles
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that there is a demarcated space for parking of the vehicles as well as for the Ambulances and vehicles are parked systematically

checkpoint.name: Hospital has a system for periodic maintenance of infrastructure at pre-defined interval
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the records for preventive maintenance of the building. It should be done at least annually.

checkpoint.name: Hospital has intact boundary wall and functional gates at entry
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that there is a proper boundary wall of adequate height without any breach. Wall is painted in uniform colour

checkpoint.name: Hospital Infrastructure is well maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: No major cracks, seepage, chipped plaster & floors in the hospital

checkpoint.name: Electric wiring and Fittings are maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check to ensure that there are no loose hanging wires, open or broken electricity panels

checkpoint.name: Adequate illumination in Procedure Areas (Labour Room/ OT)
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for Adequate lighting arrangements The illumination should be 300 Lux in procedure areas. Toilets should have at least 100 lux light.

checkpoint.name: Use of energy efficient bulbs
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that hospital uses energy efficient bulb like CFL or LED for lighting purpose within the Hospital Premises

checkpoint.name: Adequate illumination in Circulation Area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for Adequate lighting arrangements through Natural Light or Electric Bulbs.

checkpoint.name: Adequate illumination in front of hospital and access road
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that hospital front, entry gate and access road are well illuminated

checkpoint.name: Adequate illumination in Indoor Areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for Adequate lighting arrangements through Natural Light or Electric Bulbs. The illumination should be 150-300 Lux at Nursing station and 100 Lux in the wards

checkpoint.name: There is a system of preventive maintenance of furniture and fixtures
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if hospital has an annual preventive maintenance programme for furniture and fixtures, at least once in a year.

checkpoint.name: Window and doors are maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if Window panes are intact, and provided with Grill/ Wire Meshwork. Doors are intact and painted /varnished

checkpoint.name: Furniture at the nursing station, staff room, administrative office are maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the condition of furniture at nursing station, duty room,office, etc. The furniture is not broken, painted/polished and clean.

checkpoint.name: Patient Beds & Mattresses are in good condition
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that Patient beds are not rusted and are painted. Mattresses are clean and not torn

checkpoint.name: Trolleys, Stretchers, Wheel Chairs, etc. are well maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that Trolleys, Stretcher, wheel chairs are intact, painted and clean. Wheels of stretcher and wheel chair are aligned and properly lubricated

checkpoint.name: No junk material in critical service area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if unused articles, and old records are kept in the Labourroom, OT, Injection room, Dressing room etc.

checkpoint.name: No junk material in Open Areas and corridors
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if unused/ condemned equipment, vehicles, etc. are kept in the corridors, pathways, under the stairs, open areas, roof tops, balcony, etc.

checkpoint.name: Hospital has demarcated space for keeping condemned junk material
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for availability of a demarcated & secured space for collecting and storing the junk material before its disposal

checkpoint.name: Hospital has documented and implemented Condemnation policy
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if Hospital has drafted its condemnation policy or have got one from the state. Check whether they are complying with it

checkpoint.name: No junk material in patient care areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if unused/ condemned articles, and outdated records are kept in the Nursing stations, OPD clinics, wards, etc.

checkpoint.name: No Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust on walls and roofs of corridors
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that roof, walls, corners of Corridors, Waiting area, stairs, roof top for any Cobweb, Bird Nest, etc.

checkpoint.name: Corridors are cleaned at least twice in the day with wet mop
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day. Verify with Housekeeping records

checkpoint.name: Corridors are rigorously cleaned with scrubbing / flooding once in a month
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask the staff about cleaning schedule and activities

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains in the Circulation area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that floors and walls of Corridors, Waiting area, stairs, roof top for any visible or tangible dirt, grease, stains, etc.

checkpoint.name: Surfaces are conducive of effective cleaning
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if surfaces are smooth enough for cleaning

checkpoint.name: Floors, walls, furniture and fixture are thoroughly cleaned once in a month
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff about schedule of cleaning and verify with records

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/ Stains/ Garbage in Auxiliary Area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the floors and walls of Pharmacy, Kitchen, Laundry, Mortuary, Administrative offices,for any visible or tangible dirt,grease, stains, etc.

checkpoint.name: No Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Seepage on walls and roofs of Auxiliary Area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the roof , walls, corners of Pharmacy, Kitchen, Laundry, Mortuary, Administrative offices for any Cobweb, Bird Nest,Seepage, etc.

checkpoint.name: Furniture & Fixtures are without grease and dust and cleaned daily
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Observe and ask the staff about frequency for cleaning

checkpoint.name: Auxiliary Areas are cleaned at least twice in the day with wet mop
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day. Verify with Housekeeping records.

checkpoint.name: Use of Three bucket system for cleaning
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if cleaning staff uses three bucket system for cleaning. One bucket for Cleaning solution,second for plain water and third one for wringing the mop. Ask the cleaning staff about the process

checkpoint.name: Use of separate mops for critical and semi critical areas and procedures surfaces
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if cleaning staff is using same mop for outer general areas and critical areas like OT and labour room. The mops should not be shared between critical and general area. The clothes used for cleaning procedure surfaces like OT Table and Labour Room Tables should not be used for mopping the floors.

checkpoint.name: Disinfection and washing of mops after every cleaning cycle
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if cleaning staff disinfect, clean and dry the mop before using it for next cleaning cycle.

checkpoint.name: Use unidirectional method and out word mopping
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff to demonstrate the how they apply mop on floors. It should be in one direction without returning to the starting point. The mop should move from inner area to outer area of the room.

checkpoint.name: No use of brooms in patient care areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if brooms are stored in patient care areas. Ask cleaning staff if they are using brooms for sweeping in wards, OT, Labour room. Brooms should not be used in patient care areas.

checkpoint.name: All the drains are cleaned once in a week
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with the cleaning staff about the frequency of cleaning of drains. Verify with the records.

checkpoint.name: Gradient of Drains is conducive for adequate for maintaining flow
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that the drains haveadequate slope and there is no accumulation of water or debris in it

checkpoint.name: No blocked/ over-flowing drains in the facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Observe that the drains are not overflowing or blocked

checkpoint.name: Availability of connection with Municipal Sewage System/ or Soak Pit
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if Hospital sewage has proper connection with municipal drainage system. If access to municipal system is not accessible, hospital should have a septic tank with in the premises.

checkpoint.name: Availability of closed drainage system
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if there is any open drain in the hospital premises. Hospital should have a closed drainage system. If, the hospital’s infrastructure is old and it is not possible create closed draining system, the open drains should properly covered.

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/ Stains/ Garbage in wards
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that floors and walls of indoor department for any visible or tangible dirt, grease, stains, etc.

checkpoint.name: Wards are cleaned at least thrice in the day with wet mop
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day. Verify with Housekeeping records

checkpoint.name: Floors, walls, furniture and fixture are thoroughly cleaned once in a week.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day. Verify with Housekeeping records if available

checkpoint.name: No Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust/Seepage on walls and roofs of wards
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the roof, corners of ward for any Cobweb, Bird Nest, Dust etc.

checkpoint.name: Patient Furniture, Mattresses, Fixtures are without grease and dust
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for visible dirt, dust, grease etc. Check if the items are wiped/dusted daily

checkpoint.name: Floors, walls, furniture and fixture are thoroughly cleaned once in a week.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning day. Verify with Housekeeping records if available.

checkpoint.name: OT/Labour Room floors and procedures surfaces are cleaned at least twice a day / after every surgery
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day. Verify with Housekeeping records.

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/ Stains/ Garbage in Procedure Areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that floors and walls of Labour room, OT, Dressing room for any visible or tangible dirt, grease, stains etc.

checkpoint.name: No Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Seepage in OT & Labour Room
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for roof, walls, corners of Labour Room, OT, Dressing Room for any Cobweb, Bird Nest, Seepage, etc.

checkpoint.name: OT & Labour Room Tables are without grease, body fluid and dust
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that Top, side and legs of OT Tables, Dressing Room Tables, Labour Room Tables for dirt,dried human tissue, body fluid etc.

checkpoint.name: Use of Housekeeping Checklist in Toilets
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that Housekeeping Checklist is displayed in Toilet and updated. Check Housekeeping records if checklists are daily updated for at least last one month

checkpoint.name: Use of Housekeeping Checklist in Patient Care Areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that Housekeeping Checklist is displayed in OPD, IPD, Lab, etc. Check Housekeeping records if checklists are daily updated for at least last one month

checkpoint.name: A person is designated for monitoring of Housekeeping Activities
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if a staff-member from the hospital has been designated to monitor the housekeeping activities and verify them with counter signature on housekeeping checklist.

checkpoint.name: Monitoring of adequacy and quality of material used for cleaning
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if there is any system of monitoring that adequate concentration of disinfectant solution is used for cleaning. Hospital administration take feedback from cleaning staff about efficacy of the solution and take corrective action if it is not effective.

checkpoint.name: Use of Housekeeping Checklist in Procedure Areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that Housekeeping Checklist is displayed in Labour room, OT Dressing room etc. Check Housekeeping records if checklist are daily updated for at least last one month.

checkpoint.name: Toilets have running water and functional cistern
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff to operate cistern and water taps

checkpoint.name: Floors of Toilets are Dry
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check some of the toilets randomly for dryness of floors and without residue water accumulation

checkpoint.name: No foul smell in the Toilets
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check some of the toilets randomly in indoor and outdoor areas for foul smell

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains/ Garbage in Toilets
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check some of the toilets randomly in indoor and outdoor areas for any visible dirt, grease, stains, water accumulation in toilets

checkpoint.name: Sinks and Cistern are cleaned every two hours or whenever required
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff for frequency of cleaning and verify it with house keeping records

checkpoint.name: Availability of Detergent Disinfectant solution / Hospital Grade Phenyl for Cleaning purpose
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for good quality Hospital cleaning solution preferably a ISI mark. Composition and concentration of solution is written on label. Check with cleaning staff if they are getting adequate supply. Verify the consumption records.

checkpoint.name: Availability of carbolic Acid/ Bacilocid for surface cleaning in procedure areas- OT, Labour Room
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for adequacy of the supply. Verify with the records of stock outs, if any

checkpoint.name: Availability of Buckets and carts for Mopping
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if adequate numbers of Buckets and carts are available. General and critical areas should have separate bucket and carts.

checkpoint.name: Availability of Cleaning Equipment
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the availability of mops, brooms, collection buckets etc. as per requirement. Hospital with a size of more than 300 beds should have mechanized mopping machine.

checkpoint.name: Cleaning staff uses correct concentration of cleaning solution
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if the cleaning staff is aware of correct concentration and dilution method for preparing cleaning solution. Ask them to demonstrate. Verify it with the instruction given solution bottle.

checkpoint.name: No Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Seepage on walls and roofs of ambulatory area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for roof , walls, corners of OPD, Emergency, Laboratory, Radiology for any Cobweb, Bird Nest, Dust, Seepage, etc.

checkpoint.name: Ambulatory Areas are cleaned at least thrice in the day with wet mop
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day. Verify with Housekeeping records

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains / Garbage in Ambulatory Area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for floors and walls of OPD, Emergency, Laboratory, Radiology for any visible or tangible dirt, grease, stains, etc.

checkpoint.name: Floors, walls, furniture and fixture are thoroughly cleaned once in a week.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff about schedule of cleaning and verify with records

checkpoint.name: Furniture, & Fixtures are without grease and dust and cleaned daily
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Observe and ask the staff about frequency for cleaning

checkpoint.name: Recyclable and Biodegradable Wastes have segregated collection
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of two types of bins for collecting Recyclables and Biodegradables - Kerb collection point, wards, OPD, Patient Waiting Area, Pharmacy, Office, Cafeteria

checkpoint.name: The Facility Undertakes efforts to educate patients and visitors about segregation of recyclable and biodegradable wastes
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Posters/ Work instructions are displayed at the locations, where two types of bins have been kept

checkpoint.name: Availability of Compost Pit within the premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of pit within the premises; If a facility has linkage with municipal waste management system for collection of general waste, please award full compliance

checkpoint.name: General Waste is not mixed with infected waste
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check bins to ascertain that such mixing does not take place

checkpoint.name: The facility has introduced innovations in managing General Waste
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if certain innovative practices have been introduced for managing general waste e.g. Vermicomposting, Re-cycling of papers, Waste to energy, Compost Activators, etc.

checkpoint.name: The facility has started undertaking actions, which are to be complied by March 2018
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Please check the records and interview the personnel to ascertain that the hospital has started actions for followings -
a. Procurement of Non-chlorinated bags
b. Development of Website and uploading of Annual Report
c. Actions for meeting emission standards as given in BMW Rules 2016.

checkpoint.name: The facility has implemented Biomedical Waste Rules
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Interview the concerned personnel and verify following actions - 
a. Change in colour scheme 
b. Linkage with CWTF, if located within 75 kms OR Approval for Deep Burial pit 
c. 'On-site' pre-treatment of laboratory waste before handing over to the CTF Operator

checkpoint.name: An existing committee or newly constituted committee for review and monitoring of BMW management at DH/CHC level
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the record to ensure that the committee has met at least at six monthly interval and BMW status has been reviewed

checkpoint.name: The Hospital leadership is aware of Biomedical Waste Rules 2016 including key changes in the rule vis~a~vis Biomedical Waste Rule 1998.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: A copy of the Biomedical waste management rules is available at the facility.

checkpoint.name: The facility has started undertaking actions, which are to be complied by March 2017
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Please check the records and interview the personnel to ascertain that the hospital has started actions for procurement of Bar coded bags & containers

checkpoint.name: Disinfected Glassware is stored as per protocol given in Schedule I of the BMW Rules 2016
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify that all glassware is stored in a Cardboard with Blue coloured marking and later sent for recycling

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of needle stick injury Protocol and PEP is available to the staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Ask staff immediate management of exposure site; and Medical Officer knows criteria for PEP. 
Please check records of reporting of Needle Stick Injury case, PEP, and follow-up

checkpoint.name: Sharp Waste is stored in Puncture proof containers
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of Puncture & leak proof container (White Translucent) at point of use for storing needles, syringes with fixed needles, needles from cutter/burner, scalpel blade, etc.
